title: How to Delete an Account From the Gmail App + Quick Fixes

steps.title: Open the Gmail app.
steps.content: Open the Gmail app. This looks like a multi-colored M with a white background. If you're logged into Gmail , you should see your inbox. [1] X Research source Gmail is available for iOS in the App Store and for Android in the Google Play Store . This is different from removing a Google account on Android, which will remove everything associated with that account (email, contacts, settings, etc.). [2] X Research source

steps.title: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner.
steps.content: Tap your profile picture in the top-right corner. This will either be an uploaded picture or your first initial with a colored background. A pop-up menu will open.

steps.title: Tap Manage accounts on this device.
steps.content: Tap Manage accounts on this device . You can find this at the very bottom of the pop-up menu. If you have a lot of email accounts added to Gmail, you may need to scroll down to find this button.

steps.title: Tap Remove from this device.
steps.content: Tap Remove from this device . This will be under the account you want to delete. If you want to hide an account's emails without removing it from the device, tap the switch to toggle it off. When you want to see the account's emails again, toggle the switch on.

steps.title: Tap Remove.
steps.content: Tap Remove . This will confirm your action. You'll no longer be able to access or send emails using this account on the Gmail app. If you want to delete another account, tap Remove from this device underneath the account, and then tap Remove to confirm. If you are deleting the only account on the Gmail app, you may be required to input your password or PIN for security.

steps.title: Restart the app.
steps.content: Restart the app. Close the app fully and open it again. If the app has been running in the background for a while, it may just need a simple reboot.

steps.title: Update the app.
steps.content: Update the app. Updates provide important bug fixes. If you're not seeing a certain button, or if the interface isn't loading, you may need to update your app.

steps.title: Uninstall the app and install it again.
steps.content: Uninstall the app and install it again. If the app is still buggy after an update, try to delete the app fully, and then download it from the App Store or Google Play Store again.

steps.title: Remove the account from your phone (Android only).
steps.content: Remove the account from your phone (Android only). If the account is still showing up in Gmail, it's possible you have it added to your phone itself. Keep in mind that removing an account on your phone will remove all information associated with that account. You can get the data back if you sync your account again. Open Settings . Tap Password & accounts or Users & accounts . Tap the account you want to remove. Tap Remove account . Tap Remove account again. If this is the only Google account on your phone, you'll need to enter your password, PIN, or pattern.
